issue.title: Bugs in Exception handling code under Python 3

content.raw:
I hit this too and have made a pull request (pull request #21).
Is there any remaining problem if we just make it work on Python 3 as-is? The errors are about global evaluation, so a line number is not relevant to the user - would only be relevant to us in debugging the fact that the exception handling code itself crashed.
